org.dotplot.ui.monitor
Class DotPlotProgressMonitor

java.lang.Object
  org.dotplot.ui.monitor.DotPlotProgressMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, org.eclipse.swt.events.SelectionListener, org.eclipse.swt.internal.SWTEventListener
public class DotPlotProgressMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.eclipse.swt.events.SelectionListener

DotPlotProgressMonitor is a Singleton that manages the DotPlotProgressDialog.

Author:
Sascha Hemminger
See Also:
DotPlotProgressDialog

Method Detail

getInstance

public static DotPlotProgressMonitor getInstance()
DotPlotProgressMonitor is a Singleton. Use getInstance to access it.

Returns:
the one and only instance

getControl

public boolean getControl(MonitorablePlotUnit plotUnit)
use getControl to access monitoring with your PlotUnit.

Parameters:
plotUnit - your PlotUnit (most likely a controller) that can tell its progress
Returns:
true if you have monitoring now else false

showProgress

public void showProgress(int maxUnits)
starts a new dialog.

Parameters:
maxUnits - number of modules to monitor

update

public void update()
use this to tell the monitor you have worked an amount it will ask your unit for messages and percentage of work done.
